intro: Parentucellia latifolia f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered broadleaf parentucellia, is a variant of the parentucellia plant characterized by its pale or white flowers. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is native to southern Europe. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
